medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation of a nonhealing papule on the extensor surface of the upper aspect of her arm.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of 5 basal cell carcinomas (BCCs) on the face, with the first one occurring at age 18. Symptoms have progressed to multiple BCCs identified at a young age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cartilage hair hypoplasia diagnosed in early childhood; Hirschprungâ€™s disease; genu varum status postbilateral osteotomies; cervical dysplasia; severe varicella reaction necessitating treatment with immunoglobulin.
medical_history.family_history: Positive family history for cartilage hair hypoplasia; two distant cousins affected by the disease and belief that one cousin also had lymphoma. Parents are of normal height with no history of nonmelanoma skin cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is of Amish descent. She has not been exposed to arsenic, has used tanning beds on only 3 occasions, and did not experience many blistering sunburns during childhood.
